body.title: a)
body.body: Fix mouse brain on cryosectioning holder.

body.title: b)
body.body: Cut 20 µm tissue sections at -25°C and transfer these onto glass slides before measurement or store the slides at -80°C until measurement.

body.title: a)
body.body: Fix sample on a MALDI target plate with double sided sticker and mark the region of interest  with a colored pen.

body.title: b)
body.body: Dissolve matrix \(DHB 30 mg/ml; CHCA 7 mg/ml) in 1 ml 1:1 \(v/v) acetone/water mixture containing 0.1% TFA.

body.title: c)
body.body: Apply 80 µl matrix solution using a pneumatic sprayer system with a flow rate of 10 µl/min, sample rotation speed of 350 rpm and a gas pressure of 1 bar.

body.title: d)
body.body: Check matrix layer quality, crystal size and homogenous coverage with an optical microscope.

body.title: a)
body.body: Calibrate m/z  scale of mass spectrometer.

body.title: b)
body.body: Mount MALDI target with sample on the target support of the AP-SMALDI MSI source.

body.title: c)
body.body: Search region of interest  with the optical sample observation camera.

body.title: d)
body.body: Set the mass spectrometer to a mass range of m/z 300-1200 and fix injection time to 500 ms. Apply 4 kV to the MALDI target and set laser settings to 30 laser pulses per spot/pixel with a repetition rate of 60 Hz.

body.title: e)
body.body: Focus laser outside the region of interest by maximizing the intensity and simultaneously lowering the laser pulse energy. Identify the focal plane by inspection of the resulting MALDI mass spectra: If the signal to noise ratio is well-above 3 for as many compounds as possible for a minimal laser energy setting the focal plane is reached.

body.title: f)
body.body: Set the step size \(lateral resolution) of the measurement \(e.g. 10 µm) and the corresponding number of pixels \(e.g. 500x500) in the control software of the AP-SMALDI MSI source in order to measure the region of interest. Adjust laser pulse energy to a value that allows to measure with the set lateral resolution.

body.title: e)
body.body: Start data acquisition and the MSI experiment in the control software of the MSI source.

body.title: a)
body.body: Load mass spectrometric data and imaging data with the MIRION<sup>12</sup> imaging software.

body.title: b)
body.body: Set image bin width to m/z ±0.01.

body.title: c)
body.body: Export all relevant images with their corresponding intensity weighted centroid m/z value as

body.title: d)
body.body: Combine three different ion images into a red-green-blue \(RGB) overlay image. Generate all MS images without further image processing steps such as smoothing or interpolation. Normalize MS images to the base pixel \(highest intensity) per image \(m/z bin).

body.title: e)
body.body: Import the m/z value list \(*.csv file) into a data base \(e.g. METLIN <sup>13</sup> database) and search for data base entries with a search window of 2 ppm for accurate mass compound assignment.

title: **5) H&E stain for histological classification after MSI**

body.title: a)
body.body: Dehydrate the sample in ethanol and gradually increase the demineralized water content: 100% ethanol for 2 min, 70% ethanol for 2 min, 40% ethanol for 2 min, demineralized water for 2 min.

body.title: b)
body.body:
Stain sample with hematoxylin for 12 min.


c)Wash the sample with tap water for 10 min followed by demineralized water for 5 min.

body.title: d)
body.body: Apply 1% aqueous Eosin Y solution to the sample for 1 min.

body.title: e)
body.body: Differentiate in demineralized water and gradually increase the ethanol content: demineralized water for 2 min, 40% ethanol for 2 min, 70% ethanol for 2 min and 100% ethanol for 2 min.

body.title: f)
body.body: Rinse the sample with Xylol for 2 min.

body.title: h)
body.body: Fixate the sample with eukitt between glass slides.
